name: Ezekiel Bread I
author: Karin  Christian
summary: This is the bread that Ezekiel lived off of while he was in the desert for two years. It is supposed to be nutritionally complete. The recipe calls for grinding your own flour from a variety of grains and dried beans.
ingredients: 4 cups warm water (110 degrees F/45 degrees C)
directions: Measure the water, honey, olive oil, and yeast into a large bowl
Stir all of the grains and beans together until well mixed
Add fresh milled flour and salt to the yeast mixture; stir until well mixed, about 10 minutes
The dough will be like that of a batter bread
Pour dough into two greased 9 x 5 inch loaf pans
Let rise in a warm place for about 1 hour, or until dough has reached the top of the pan
Bake at 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) for 45 to 50 minutes, or until loaves are golden brown
